title: Bebe Rexha Backs It Up on A Private Jet, Pilots Don’t Seem To Mind
text:
Bebe Rexha knows how to fly in style even, if that style is a throwback to 1999.

Although Rexha recently celebrated her 30th birthday, the star shared a video where she is acting very Juvenile.

She was backing it up to the 90’s classic “Back That AZZ Up,” and it looks like the pilots were the ones who were most impressed.

“In case of emergency please back that ass up,” Bebe’s caption read.

Related:

'Mob Wives' Star Drita D'Avanzo Drops 'Good Form' Freestyle in Nicki Minaj Tribute

Drita D'Avanzo Signs On to Officiate Farrah Abraham Boxing Match

'Mob Wives' Star Drita D'Avanzo Challenges Farrah Abraham in Celeb Boxing

Her Famous Friends Love It

View photos

Some of her famous friends could not contain their excitement.

Chainsmokers star, Alex Pall commented, “Hahahaha you’re a legend,” while “Mob Wives” star, Drita D'Avanzo left several laughing emojis.

Lighting Up The Gram

Rexha has been lighting her gram up with pictures and videos where she is embracing her body and personality.

She shared a racy bathroom pic for her birthday.

“This is what 30 looks like. My #BirthdaySuit Self love. Body positivity. Unapologetically me,” Bebe said alongside the heart racing photo.

Making Headlines

She also graced the cover of 2019’s Cosmopolitan UK issue, smiling and utilizing a hand bra.

Over the years, Rexha has been really open about the state of women in the music industry with the most recent example coming last month.

“I recently had a MALE music executive tell me that I was getting too old and that my brand was 'confusing.' Because… I’m a songwriter and I post sexy pics on my Instagram and that’s not what female songwriters are supposed to do, especially for my age. I’m 29,” she wrote.

Bebe is a fan favorite because she is so open and honest with her fans but the twerking videos help a little too.
